org.jetel.util.string

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.string.StringUtils

  • public class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class with some useful methods regarding string/text manipulation
    Since:
    July 25, 2002

      • bytesToHexString

        public static java.lang.String bytesToHexString(byte[] buf)
        Converts the given byte array into its HEX representation (that can be used for display). For instance byte[] { 1, 10, 15, 16, 127, -127, 0, 63, 64, 65} will be converted to "010A0F107F81003F4041"
        Parameters:
        buf - converted byte array
        Returns:
        string hex representation of the given byte array

      • hexStringToBytes

        public static byte[] hexStringToBytes(java.lang.String str)
        Converts the given string with HEX representation of an array into the byte array. For instance "010A0F107F81003F4041" will be converted to byte[] { 1, 10, 15, 16, 127, -127, 0, 63, 64, 65}
        Parameters:
        str - string to be converted
        Returns:
        represented byte array

      • isVowel

      • metaphone

        public static java.lang.String metaphone(java.lang.String input,
                         int maxLength)
        Finds the metaphone value of a String. This is similar to the soundex algorithm, but better at finding similar sounding words. All input is converted to upper case. Limitations: Input format is expected to be a single ASCII word with only characters in the A - Z range, no punctuation or numbers.
        Parameters:
        input - String to find the metaphone code for
        maxLength - Maximal length of output string
        Returns:
        A metaphone code corresponding to the String supplied

      • metaphone

        public static java.lang.String metaphone(java.lang.String input)

        Returns:
        the result of encoding

        Returns:

      • formatString

        public static java.lang.String formatString(java.lang.Object[] messages,
                            int[] sizes,
                            char fillchar)
        Formats string from specified messages and their lengths.
        Negative (<0) length means justify to the left, positive (>0) to the right
        If message is longer than specified size, it is trimmed; if shorter, it is padded with specified fill char.
        Parameters:
        messages - array of objects with toString() implemented methods
        sizes - array of desired lengths (+-) for every message specified
        Returns:
        Formatted string

      • normalizeName

        public static java.lang.String normalizeName(java.lang.String originalName)
        This function should be used to convert arbitrary field or record name into a valid identifier. Valid identifiers (containing) should be left untouched. Empty strings should be replaced with a string containing one underscore so that metadata extraction works even for databases which do not return table name in the ResultSetMetadata. Even valid identifiers should be truncated to DEFAULT_TRUNC_LENGTH.
        Parameters:
        originalName -
        Returns:

      • convertNameToId

        public static java.lang.String convertNameToId(java.lang.String name)
        Normalizes the name, inserts an underscore after each lower-case letter followed by an upper-case letter and converts the result to upper-case. The proposed ID may not be unique!
        Parameters:
        name - name of the component
        Returns:
        proposal of the new ID of the component (not unique)

      • unquote2

        public static java.lang.String unquote2(java.lang.String s)
        Modifies string so that the string quotes are ignored, in case quotes are not present doesn't do anything. Escaped quote character is left without the backslash. For example: dummy -> dummy "dummy" -> dummy a"dummy" -> a"dummy" "dummy"a -> "dummy"a "I said: \"hello\"" -> I said: "hello"
        Parameters:
        str -
        Returns:

        public static short isInteger(java.lang.CharSequence str)
        This method checks if given string can be parse to integer number
        Parameters:
        str - string to check
        Returns:
        -1 if str is not integer
        0 if str can be parsed to short
        1 if str can be parsed to int
        2 if str can be parsed to long
        3 if str is integer but has more than 18 digits

      • subString

        public static java.lang.Appendable subString(java.lang.Appendable target,
                             java.lang.CharSequence src,
                             int from,
                             int length)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method copies substring of source to target.
        Parameters:
        target - target to which save the substring
        src - source string
        from - positing at which start (zero based)
        length - number of characters to take
        Returns:
        target containing substring of original or empty string if specified from/length values are out of ranges. If from+length exceeds src.lenght, target.lenght is only src.lenght-from
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        23.5.2007

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(java.lang.CharSequence input,
          java.lang.CharSequence pattern,
          int fromIndex)

        Parameters:
        input - string for searching
        pattern - the substring for which to search
        fromIndex - the index from which to start the search
        Returns:
        the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified substring, starting at the specified index, or -1 if the sequence does not occur

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(java.lang.CharSequence input,
          char ch,
          int fromIndex)
        Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character, starting the search at the specified index
        Parameters:
        input - input string for searching
        cha - character
        fromIndex - the index from which to start the search
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the character in the character sequence that is greater than or equal to fromIndex, or -1 if the character does not occur

      • startsWith

        public static boolean startsWith(java.lang.CharSequence input,
                 int offset,
                 java.lang.CharSequence prefix)
        Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.
        Parameters:
        input - input string to check
        offset - index at which start (zero based)
        prefix - the prefix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the prefix argument is a prefix of the character sequence represented by the input string; false otherwise. Note also that true will be returned if the argument is an empty string or is equal to this String object as determined by the equals(Object) method.

      • startsWith

                 java.lang.CharSequence subString)
        Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.
        Parameters:
        input - input string to check
        prefix - the prefix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the prefix argument is a prefix of the character sequence represented by the input string; false otherwise. Note also that true will be returned if the argument is an empty string or is equal to this String object as determined by the equals(Object) method.

      • abbreviateString

        public static java.lang.CharSequence abbreviateString(java.lang.CharSequence input,
                                      int elementLength,
                                      boolean capitalize,
                                      boolean useNumbers)
        Abbreviates input char sequence by using first letter of each word composing the sequence. Skips any spaces, punctuation and other special chars.
        Parameters:
        input - character sequence to abbreviate
        elementLength - how many characters from each word to use (if more than 1, then each element is divided by "_" in output
        capitalize - capitalize letters - i.e. convert to uppercase
        useNumbers - also include numbers in sequence
        Returns:
        abbreviation of input sequence
